sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to get your <radical>fingers</radical> around a <radical>temple</radical> if you want to <kanji>hold</kanji> it. Is the temple too big? Hold smaller temples you can buy in the temple's souvenir shop.
meaningInfo: Imagine holding a tiny temple in your fingers. Hold it up to the light. Hold it on the train. Hold it while you sleep.
readingMnemonic: As you <kanji>hold</kanji> the temple you hear a voice. You look down through your fingers and see a tiny <reading>Je</reading>sus (<ja>じ</ja>). He's smiling and gives you a thumbs up. Aww, thanks Jesus!
readingInfo: Jesus likes when you hold things like temples. He probably likes when you hold other things too, like ice cream, puppies, and homeless peoples' hands.
